data.title: Get ready to sail the high seas because we’ve got all the goss about Below Deck Down Under Season Three
data.meta_description: Below Deck Down Under is back for season three despite rumours it'd been canned, and here's everything we know about the new season
data.text:
All aboard the Hot Mess Express because Below Deck Down Under is back for Season Three, and we can’t wait!

Despite rumours the hit show would be cancelled after its second season saw several instances of sexual misconduct, Bravo confirmed that BDDU would be back for another run.

Whilst little has been confirmed about the upcoming season, several cast members have been leaked as well as a potential filming location.

If you love a lil’ spoiler action, keep scrolling to find out everything we know about Below Deck Down Under Season Three!

Which cast mates are joining Below Deck Down Under?

According to Reality Tea, Season Three will see three returning cast members and seven new yachties take the high seas.

Captain Jason Chambers confirmed he’d be gracing our screens again during an interview with InTouch in December 2023.

Beloved chef Tzarina Mace-Ralph and deckhand Harry Van Vliet, who both appeared in Season Two, are also said to return to the show.

Reality Tea also dropped seven names rumoured to join the crew next year, including Tzoni Arvanitis (Bosun), Wihan Du Toit (Deckhand), Adair Werley (Deckhand), Nicolas Cattelan (Deckhand), Brianna Duffield (Stew), and Marina Marcondes (Stew).

Lara Rigby is also tipped to be the Chief Stew after Aesha Scott made the move to Below Deck Mediterranean. However, her social media appears to have been deactivated since she was rumoured to join the cast.

Where is Below Deck Down Under Season Three filmed?

One eagle-eyed fan took to Reddit after spotting a film crew in La Digue, Seychelles, a small country in East Africa.

“Walking along Anse Source D’Argent yesterday and came across the crew filming around a lunch table for an ‘unnamed boat show’ to air in the future. The cameramen had hats with Below Deck written on the back,” they wrote.

Another user responded, stating they’d got details about a “potential casting” for the show, confirming the crew was for BDDU Season Three.

“They’ll be filming for another two weeks there,” they added. And we think this is an interesting choice of location, given the show is meant to be set in Australia.

However, per Reality Tea, a production insider told the New York Times that fans should expect a HUGE shakeup on the Aussie rendition of the reality show. So, time will tell!

What else do we know about Below Deck Down Under Season Three?

According to Reality Tea, Nikita Sachdev, the founder of Luna Media Group, could be a charter guest on the upcoming season of BDDU.

The entrepreneur shared snaps on a yacht around the time of filming, and one was captioned: “In love with #seychelles.”

Captain Jason and the leaked crew are also reportedly following her and the people she travelled with.

Jessica Weldon, another potential charter guest, has also shared snaps on the sea, tagging Seychelles as the location.

These sneaky pics also showed off the show’s new yacht, Katina.

Watch this space for more updates!

Want even more goss? Listen to the So Dramatic! podcast with Megan Pustetto below!

Know something that we don’t? Spill the tea here!
